content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 10 to node 18 in the given graph is:

10 -> 5 -> 18

This path uses the edges 0->9, 1->12, 2->6, 3->11, 5->15, and 7->14. Please note that this is the shortest path starting from node 10 and ending at node 18. If you change the endpoint to be the previous point (i.e., start from node 18), the shortest path will be:

The shortest path is 18 -> 22 -> 24 which is also the original shortest path minus the last point.

The shortest path from node 10 to node 22 in the given graph is:

10 -> 5 -> 22

This path uses the edges 0->9, 1->12, 2->6, 3->11, 5->15, and 7->23. Please note that this is the shortest path starting from node 10 and ending at node 22. If you change the endpoint to be the previous point (i.e., start from node 22), the shortest path will be:

The shortest path is 22 -> 24 which is also the original shortest path minus the last point.
